cm.sv: Therefore leaving the doctrine of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfectionnot laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God, Entonces dejando los principios de la doctrina de Cristo, vayamos a la perfección, no poniendo de nuevo el fundamento de arrepentimiento de obras muertas, y de fe en Dios,

of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment. de la enseñanza de los bautismos, de la imposición de manos, de la resurrección de los muertos y del juicio eterno.
This will we do, if God permits. Y esto haremos, si Dios permite.

For concerning those who were once enlightened and tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Spirit, Pues es imposible Para facilitar lectura pone la palabra imposible en el versículo 6, pero está en el versículo 4 según , y .
los que una vez fueron iluminados y que probaron el don celestial, y que fueron hechos participes del Espíritu Santo,
and tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the age to come, y que probaron la buena palabra de Dios, y los milagros del tiempo que vendrá

and then fell away, it is impossible to renew them again to repentance; seeing they crucify the Son of God for themselves again, and put him to open shame. y caen, sean renovados otra vez para arrepentimiento; crucificaron por si mismos al Hijo de Dios nuevamente, y lo avergonzaron públicamente.

For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it, and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God; Pues la tierra que bebió la lluvia que con frecuencia viene a ella, y da una cosecha dice `cosecha,´ dice `hierbas,´ dice `hierba.´ Según la palabra griega `βοτανην´ se traduce como hierba para alimento, hierba verde, planta que crece.
apropiada para aquellos por quienes es labrada, recibe bendiciones de Dios;
but if it bears thorns and thistles, it is rejected and near being cursed, whose end is to be burned. más la que lleva espinas y cardos, es rechazada y casi maldecida, cuyo fin es ser quemada.

But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this. Pero, amados, confiamos en mejores cosas de ustedes, y que acompañan la salvación, aún cuando hablemos así.

For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you
showed toward his name, in that you served the saints, and still do serve them.
We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end,
that you won´t be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises.
For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he swore by himself,
saying, «Most surely I will bless you, and I will surely multiply you.»
Thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
For men indeed swear by a greater one, and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation.
that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.
This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into that which is within the veil;
where as a forerunner Jesus entered for us, having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.
